title.content-text: 4.1.4 Options for Connecting to the ISP

brief.content-text:
Diagram 2, Interactive
The diagram illustrates six devices that enable different methods of connection to the Internet, and provides a brief description of each.

Dialup Modem
The slowest and most widely available service. Uses regular voice grade telephone lines.

Cell Modem
Service available through cell phone providers. Relatively slow access speeds, but becoming more common.

Digital subscriber Line (DSL)
Service available from most telephone companies. Provides highspeed digital connections over regular telephone lines.

Cable Modem
Service available from most cable companies. Provides highspeed service over the cable TV network.

Leased line
Service available from most telephone companies. Provides high-speed connection over dedicated digital data lines. The most common example of a leased line is a T1 (E1). Primarily for a business-class service.

Satellite
Service available from Internet dish satellite companies. Provides medium speeds via satellite. Satellite may be the only choice faster than dial-up in some rural areas.
